title: Compute Arithmetic from Input
description:
Read two integers, perform labelled arithmetic, and show the quotient with one decimal place.

Steps:
1. Prompt with `Enter the first integer:` and read the first value into an `int`.
2. Prompt with `Enter the second integer:` and read the second value into an `int`.
3. Compute the sum, difference (first minus second), product, and floating-point quotient (first divided by second).
4. Before printing the quotient, stream `std::fixed << std::setprecision(1)` so the division result keeps exactly one decimal place.
5. Print each labelled result on its own line using the exact text shown below.

Input format:
Line 1: first integer.
Line 2: second integer.

Expected output (replace numbers with the actual calculations):
Enter the first integer:
Enter the second integer:
Sum: {sum}
Difference: {difference}
Product: {product}
Quotient: {quotient}

Example run (input `8` then `4`):
Enter the first integer:
Enter the second integer:
Sum: 12
Difference: 4
Product: 32
Quotient: 2.0

tests.name: computes results for 8 and 4
tests.expected:
Enter the first integer:
Enter the second integer:
Sum: 12
Difference: 4
Product: 32
Quotient: 2.0

tests.name: computes results for 5 and 2
tests.expected:
Enter the first integer:
Enter the second integer:
Sum: 7
Difference: 3
Product: 10
Quotient: 2.5

hints: Remember to include <iomanip> so you can use std::fixed and std::setprecision(1).
static_cast one of the operands to double before dividing to avoid integer division.
Print the labels exactly as shown to satisfy the tests.
